item.title: Three More Ways To Make Your Office More Efficient
item.description: In today’s corporate culture, green practices aren’t just about protecting the environment and driving sustainability — increasing efficiency in your place of business can actually have a direct impact on your company’s bottom line. item.title: Facility and Janitorial Cleaning Services to Get Your Building Summer Ready
item.description: Summer is just around the corner, and for many of us, that means longer days, greener grass, and a whole lot of seasonal sunshine. Put simply: summer can wreak havoc on a commercial building. Extreme temperature swings, violent storms, and rampant changes in humidity can all cause potentially significant damage to buildings of every size and in every district.

item.title: Smart Buildings: Top Trends To Watch For In 2019
item.description: Smart building technology has proven far more than a passing facility trend, particularly in the state of California. On May 9, 2018, the California Energy Commission (CEC) unanimously passed legislation that mandates all homes built after the start of 2020 must have solar panels. The newly adopted, dynamic energy efficiency initiative also significantly reduces the installation cost of the panels, which should directly (and positively) impact future energy consumption and waste across the state.

item.title: Four Ways to Run A Green, Clean Facility
item.description: The growth of corporate environmentalism has made its mark in industry as companies of every size and scope recognize the benefits of eco-conscious operations. For many business owners, going green is simply the right thing to do to minimize the organization’s overall carbon footprint. However, green practices can also have a direct impact on a company’s bottom line. A 2013 study revealed that a whopping 71 percent of all Americans consider the environment before making a purchase, granting ecologically aware companies an opportunity to edge out the competition just by doing what’s best for the our collective ecosystems.

item.title: Benefits of Upgrading To A Cloud-Based Platform

Is your organization considering making the move to the cloud? Understanding some of the many benefits offered with a digital data capture platform designed specifically for the janitorial industry can help you decide if it’s the right choice for your organization.

item.title: Servi-Tek Attends San Diego Commercial Properties Expo
item.description: On March 12th, 2019, Servi-Tek’s tribe of commercial cleaning professionals participated at the 2019 San Diego Commercial Property Expo. Hosted by four premier local industry organizations (BOMA, IFMA, IREM, SDBEA) at the Del Mar Fairgrounds on Jimmy Durante Boulevard, the San Diego Commercial Properties Expo is a marquee event, offering guests and participants extensive exposure to some of the region’s biggest industry influencers. San Diego Commercial Properties Expo: An Up-Close Look At The Event Each year, the BOMA expo brings together leading commercial real estate authorities to share ideas, discuss trends, and demo products as well as showcase best practices and services within the field.

item.title: Benefits And Challenges Of Passive Solar Heating
item.description: Passive solar power is changing the green heating game for companies across multiple industries. Unlike active solar designs that require expensive systems and external energy sources to power pumps, blowers, and equipment, a passive design utilizes already existing energy and leverages features of the building itself to generate heat throughout the structure. Put simply: passive solar heating strategically uses material choices, design elements, and feature placements of basic components found in most living spaces (think windows, floors, and walls) to create a smart, green environment.

When used consistently, thorough and effective commercial cleaning routines may actually mitigate the risk of workplace injuries. item.title: Servi-Tek Hawaii Attends NFPA 70E Electrical Safety Training Event
item.description: Servi-Tek Engineering recently held an NFPA 70E electrical training session for its Hawaii branch at the Waterfront Plaza Hotel in Honolulu on Wednesday, February 27th. Hosted in partnership with SI Testing, the 2-hour Lunch & Learn event was explicitly developed to promote arc flash safety and demonstrate workplace practices that minimize exposure to electrical hazards. Servi-Tek, an innovator in facilities management solutions and energy conservation strategies, offers continuous, relevant industry training that not only optimizes operational efficiencies but also prioritizes safety for both its employees and building tenants.

item.title: Emergency Preparedness: The Benefits Of A Cohesive Plan In The Workplace
item.description: An emergency preparedness plan is an important component for companies of every size and scope. At Servi-Tek, we recognize that creating an emergency preparedness plan at your place of business can yield a multitude of essential, potentially life-saving, benefits including: Promote Employee Safety First and foremost, a well-detailed emergency preparedness plan provides invaluable guidance to keep your employees safe during an unexpected event. item.title: Four Ways Building Maintenance Keeps Your Commercial Tenants Happy
item.description: Property managers recognize that tenant retention is everything. According to a white paper released in 2013 entitled, The Economic Cost of Losing a Tenant, failing to retain a commercial facility tenant isn’t just inconvenient, but also expensive. Data gathered in the report indicated that losing and replacing a renter can cost up to three times more than simply renewing a lease, making it essential to keep renters engaged and (more importantly) satisfied throughout the contract.

item.title: Servi-Tek Attends BOMA OC Year End Gala
item.description: Friday, November 2, 2018, marked BOMA (Building Owners and Managers Association) OC’s 35th annual Awards of Excellence Gala. Held at the Fashion Island Hotel in Newport Beach from 6:00pm – 11:30pm, this highly anticipated yearly event attracted hundreds of local building owners and industry professionals from throughout the region with a primary focus: to dress up, have fun, and celebrate the very best and brightest contributors in commercial real estate management, operations, and services.

item.title: Servi-Tek’s Kurt Lester Goes Over The Edge To Support Special Olympics
item.description: Servi-Tek co-founder, Kurt Lester, recently got a birds-eye view of gorgeous Waikiki and Diamond Head – as he rappelled from the rooftop of the Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach and Spa. Kurt was one of many local participants and supporters gathered for Waikiki’s Over The Edge event, a fundraiser that directly benefits Hawaii’s Special Olympics organization. Held on Saturday, October 27, 2018, the Waikiki initiative allowed sponsors who raised a qualifying minimum contribution of $1,000 a chance to go Over The Edge, rappelling 40 stories in total from hotel top to bottom for a good cause.

item.title: Four Ways Green Cleaning Solutions Improve Your Work Environment

Proctor and Gamble’s line of sustainable janitorial cleaners have passed some of our industry’s most stringent requirements to ensure superior results and minimized environmental impact on every service we provide for ultimate client peace of mind.

item.title: Servi-Tek’s Pickleball Rookies Sweep Round Robin Social
item.description: Servi-Tek officially has a new title to add to our many esteemed awards and accolades: Pickleball champions. item.title: Four Ways To Conserve Energy At Your Facility

item.title: Servi-Tek Attends IREM LA’s Cure4Kids Gala

item.title: Servi-Tek Spends Day Seaside With Surfing Madonna Oceans Project
item.description: Servi-Tek executives, Kurt Lester and Bryan McMinn, recently partnered with Surfing Madonna Oceans Project (SMOP), volunteering at the organization’s seasonal summer surf camp for children with special needs. Founded by Robert Nichols and Mark Patterson in 2013, the Encinitas-based Surfing Madonna Oceans Project is a 501c3 nonprofit entity dedicated to raising funds and awareness for the protection and preservation of California’s coastline. Each year SMOP donates back over $120,000 to initiatives designed to improve the environment, educate students, and help those with special needs enjoy a day riding the surf at some of the area’s many beaches.
